sen.j: 阿部 正允（あべ まさちか、享保元年（1716年） - 安永9年11月24日 (旧暦)（1780年12月19日））は、江戸時代の大名、老中。
sen.e: Masachika ABE (male, 1716 to December 19, 1780) was daimyo an roju in Edo period.
Masachika ABE (1716-December 19, 1780) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor) in the Edo period.
Masachika ABE (1716-December 19, 1780) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 武蔵国忍藩藩主。
sen.e: Masachika was the lord of Shinobu Domain in Musashi Province.
He was the lord of Shinobu Domain in Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: Masachika を He に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the lord of Shinobu Domain in Musashi Province.

sen.j: 忠秋系阿部家5代。
sen.e: The fifth of the ABE family of chushu clan.
He was the fifth of the ABE family of Chushu clan.
sen.cmt: 文頭に He was を追記しました。chushu を Chushu に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the fifth of the ABE family of Chushu clan.

sen.j: 5,000石を領した旗本・阿部正晴（忍藩3代藩主・阿部正武の三男）の長男。
sen.e: Masachika was the first son of hatamoto (those who were the direct retainer of Shogun), Masaharu ABE (the third son of Masatake ABE, the eighth lord of Shinobu Domain) who had 5,000 koku (an amount of rice which could feed 5,000 people for one year).

Masachika was the first son of hatamoto (direct retainer of Shogun), Masaharu ABE (third son of Masatake ABE, the eighth lord of Shinobu Domain) who was bestowed 5,000 koku (approximately 0.9 million liters of crop yield).

Masachika was the first son of hatamoto (direct retainer of Shogun), Masaharu ABE (third son of Masatake ABE, the eighth lord of Shinobu Domain) who was bestowed 5,000 koku (approximately 0.9 million liters of crop yield).

sen.j: 母は遠山友春の娘。
sen.e: Masachika's mother was a daughter of Tomoharu Toyama.
Masachika's mother was a daughter of Tomoharu TOYAMA.
sen.cmt: Toyama を TOYAMA に修正しました。
sen.e: Masachika's mother was a daughter of Tomoharu TOYAMA.

sen.j: 正室は井伊直定の養女（井伊直惟の娘）。
sen.e: Masachika's formal wife was an adopted daughter of Naosada II (a daughter of Naotsugu II).
Masachika's lawful wife was an adopted daughter of Naosada II (a daughter of Naotsugu II).
sen.cmt: formal を lawful に修正しました。
sen.e: Masachika's lawful wife was an adopted daughter of Naosada II (a daughter of Naotsugu II).

sen.j: 子は阿部正陳（次男）、白須政民（三男）、阿部正実（四男）、娘（松平光徳正室）、娘（松平容頌正室）、娘（奥平昌鹿正室）、娘（酒井忠交正室）。
sen.e: Masachika had children who were Masamune ABE (the second son), Masatami Shirasu (the third son), Masazane ABE (the fourth son), a daughter (the formal wife of Mitsutoku MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (the formal wife of Katayoshi MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (the formal wife of Masashika OKUDAIRA), and a daughter (the formal wife of Tadayoshi SAKAI).

His children included Masamune ABE (second son), Masatami Shirasu (third son), Masazane ABE (fourth son), a daughter (lawful wife of Mitsutoku MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (lawful wife of Katayoshi MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (lawful wife of of Masashika OKUDAIRA), and a daughter (lawful wife of Tadayoshi SAKAI).

His children included Masamune ABE (second son), Masatami Shirasu (third son), Masazane ABE (fourth son), a daughter (lawful wife of Mitsutoku MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (lawful wife of Katayoshi MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (lawful wife of of Masashika OKUDAIRA), and a daughter (lawful wife of Tadayoshi SAKAI).

sen.j: はじめ父の後をついで旗本となるが、宗家・忍藩に後継者がいないため阿部正喬の養子となり、寛延元年（1748年）に正喬の隠居により家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: Though Masachika first succeeded his father and became hatamoto, he was adopted by Masataka ABE because their head family, Shinobu clan had no successor and Masachika succeeded Maastaka as the head of the family when Masataka retired in 1748.

Though Masachika first succeeded his father and became hatamoto, he was adopted by Masataka ABE because their head family, Shinobu clan had no successor and Masachika succeeded Masataka as the head of the family when Masataka retired in 1748.
sen.cmt: Maastaka を Masataka に修正しました。
sen.e: Though Masachika first succeeded his father and became hatamoto, he was adopted by Masataka ABE because their head family, Shinobu clan had no successor and Masachika succeeded Masataka as the head of the family when Masataka retired in 1748.

sen.j: 翌寛延2年（1749年）奏者番、宝暦12年（1762年）大坂城代、明和元年（1764年）京都所司代、明和6年（1769年）西丸老中、安永8年（1779年）本丸老中を歴任した。
sen.e: In the next year, 1749, Masachika was appointed as soshaban (a person in charge of delivering shogun's gifts to visitors who could directly see shogun in annual big events); in 1762, as Osaka-jodai (a person in charge of managing a castle (in this case, Osaka-jo castle, for shogun when shogun is absent); in 1764, as Kyoto-shoshidai; in 1769, as nishimaru-roju (roju in west building of the castle); and, in 1779, as honmaru-roju (roju in the main building of the castle).

In the next year, 1749, Masachika was appointed as sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), then Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle) in 1762, Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) in 1764, Nishinomaru roju (roju in the west building of the castle) in 1769 and Honmaru roju (roju in the main building of the castle) in 1779.

In the next year, 1749, Masachika was appointed as sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), then Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle) in 1762, Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) in 1764, Nishinomaru roju (roju in the west building of the castle) in 1769 and Honmaru roju (roju in the main building of the castle) in 1779.

sen.j: 翌安永9年（1780年）死去。
sen.e: Masachika died in 1780.
Masachika died in 1780.
Masachika died in 1780.

sen.j: 治世下の秩父での年貢増徴反対一揆や伝馬騒動等が発生し苦難の藩政運営を強いられた。
sen.e: Masachika was forced to have a hard time in managing the Domain when an anti-tax-increase ikki (a riot) in ruled Chichibu area, tenma-sodo (a riot by workers for tenma boats), etc., arose.
Masachika was forced to have a hard time in managing his domain when an anti-tax-increase ikki (a riot) in ruled Chichibu area, tenma sodo (Post Horse Rebellion) and so on arose.
sen.cmt: tenma-sodo (a riot by workers for tenma boats), etc., をtenma sodo (Post Horse Rebellion) and so on に修正しました。
sen.e: Masachika was forced to have a hard time in managing his domain when an anti-tax-increase ikki (a riot) in ruled Chichibu area, tenma sodo (Post Horse Rebellion) and so on arose.

sen.j: 死後、家督は先代藩主・正喬の五男・阿部正敏がついだ。
sen.e: After his death, the Masatoshi ABE, the fifth son of Masataka, the ex-lord of the Domain succeeded him as the head of the family.
After his death, the Masatoshi ABE, the fifth son of Masataka, the ex-lord of the Domain succeeded him as the head of the family.
After his death, the Masatoshi ABE, the fifth son of Masataka, the ex-lord of the Domain succeeded him as the head of the family.

tit.cmt: Brief personal history をBrief Personal History に修正しました。

sen.j: 1716年（享保元年） 生誕（享保7年（1722年）3月11日 (旧暦)生まれとする説もある）
sen.e: 1716: Masachika was born (some people say that he was born in March 11, 1722.
1716: Masachika was born (some people say that he was born in April 26, 1722).
sen.cmt: March 11, 1722. を April 26, 1722). に修正しました。
sen.e: 1716: Masachika was born (some people say that he was born in April 26, 1722).

sen.j: 1730年（享保15年） 父・阿部正晴の跡を継ぎ5,000石旗本となる。
sen.e: 1730: Succeeded his father, Masaharu ABE and became hatamoto receiving 5,000 koku of rice.
1730: He succeeded his father, Masaharu ABE and became hatamoto receiving 5,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 文頭に He を追記しました。of rice を削除しました。
sen.e: 1730: He succeeded his father, Masaharu ABE and became hatamoto receiving 5,000 koku.

sen.j: 1733年（享保18年） 阿部正喬の養子となる
sen.e: 1733: Was adopted by Masataka ABE.
1733: He was adopted by Masataka ABE.
sen.cmt: 文頭に He を追記しました。
sen.e: 1733: He was adopted by Masataka ABE.

sen.j: 1748年（寛延元年） 忍藩を相続する
sen.e: 1748: Succeeded to Shinobu Domain.
1748: He succeeded to the Shinobu Domain.
sen.cmt: 文頭に He を追記しました。Shinobu Domain に the を追記しました。
sen.e: 1748: He succeeded to the Shinobu Domain.

sen.j: 1749年（寛延2年） 奏者番就任
sen.e: 1749: Was appointed as soshaban.
1749: He was appointed as soshaban.
sen.cmt: 文頭に He を追記しました。
sen.e: 1749: He was appointed as soshaban.

sen.j: 1759年（宝暦9年） 奏者番辞任、伺候席
sen.e: 1759: Resigned soshaban and appointed as ukagaisoroseki.
1759: He resigned soshaban and appointed as shikoseki (anteroom seats for feudal lords and direct retainer of the shogun at the Edo-jo Castle).
1759: He resigned soshaban and appointed as shikoseki (anteroom seats for feudal lords and direct retainer of the shogun at the Edo-jo Castle).

sen.j: 1762年（宝暦12年）12月9日 (旧暦) 大坂城代（1764年6月21日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: December 9 (old calendar), 1762: Was appointed as Osaka-jodai to June 21 (old calendar), 1764.
January 22, 1763-July 19, 1764: He was appointed as Osaka jodai.
January 22, 1763-July 19, 1764: He was appointed as Osaka jodai.

sen.j: 1764年（明和元年）6月21日 京都所司代
sen.e: June 21, 1764: Was appointed as Kyoto-shoshidai.
July 19, 1764: He was appointed as Kyoto shoshidai.
July 19, 1764: He was appointed as Kyoto shoshidai.

sen.j: 1769年（明和6年） 西丸老中（- 1779年4月16日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1769: Was appointed as nishimaru-roju (to April 16 (old calendar), 1779).
1769-May 31, 1779: He was appointed as Nishimaru roju.
1769-May 31, 1779: He was appointed as Nishimaru roju.

sen.j: 1779年（安永8年）4月16日 本丸老中
sen.e: April 16, 1779: Was appointed as honmaru-roju.
May 31, 1779: He was appointed as Honmaru roju.
May 31, 1779: He was appointed as Honmaru roju.

sen.j: 1780年（安永9年）11月24日 死去、享年64。
sen.e: November 24, 1780: Died at the age of 64.
December 19, 1780: He died at the age of 64.
December 19, 1780: He died at the age of 64.

1733: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), the governor of Noto Province
1733: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), the governor of Noto Province
